pattern.name: Change count
pattern.description:
Count number of changes in an ordered list.
Note: This pattern is different from the count of duplicates - you can have a list of binary values, but still have more than two changes.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , sum(is_change) AS "@columnName" FROM ( SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , (CASE WHEN lag(@column) OVER (ORDER BY @timeColumn) != @column THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) is_change FROM @propagatedTable ) t GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget
